content.description: Tall wall of holds, squeezed in between Loki’s Lurch and Lucifer’s Lean. Lots of eliminates and variants possible on this one.
Start standing and jam up the obvious flared crack. Over as soon as it begins.
content.location: Obvious crack on the left side of the Norseman

content.description: Traverse the left leaning crack to a juggy arete. Sit start.

Sit start left of Valhalla start, climb straight up to the apex using slopers and meager holds on the face. This line feels arbitrary and somewhat contrived as it’s easier to use the left or right arete, they degrade the problem so much tho I’d coned it a V0 at that point. Still, arbitrary and contrived, this line is fun and worth doing if you’re here.
content.location: Left of Valhalla start, right of “no such thing”

content.description: A super fun traverse across all of the Norseman. Start using the starting jug of No Such Thing. Traverse down Stairway to Valhalla where you'll find the crux. Continue moving right all the way until you top out on Eric the Northman. There are too many ways to have fun on this line. It can go backwards but I would argue it is worse.
content.location: Below Cobra commander boulder and above Pistol Grip boulder

content.description: No such thing as a jug ladder outside huh? Fun, simple problem on the left of a nice V2 line. Sit start it, dyno the first move if you are feeling spicy.
content.location: This is a V0- variation of what seems to be a pretty popular line to the left, though I'm not sure what the name of that problem is, but it seems like a V2. This is a good problem for a warm up.

content.description: One of the more enjoyable problems in the area. Sit start and pull a few compression moves to a low top out. Only the center boulder is on.
Start in the crack on two good holds. Starting with a toe hook is 'easiest' but depends on your height.
content.location: In the middle of the Norseman

content.description: This short little route is barely worth doing.Sit start or squat start with the lowest holds you can manage, pull on and throw for the slopes ledge, a simple top out and the problem is done before it really started.
content.location: Furthest line right on the block.

content.description: Sweet little Smith-y boulder with nice flakes & pockets (when they aren't under moss). Top out in the crack. There is a V2 variation (Second Breakfast) if you sit-start the problem.
content.location: After following the game trail into the woods from the pull out for about 50 yards, head down the middle of the hill for another 50 or so yards & you'll come upon the backside of the boulder. There is nice flat ground for pads & it's next door to some other problems already pictured in this area.

content.description: This boulder is a great warmup, pretty well climbed out with 8 established lines. If it were another 5-10 feet tall it would host some 4 star lines, as is many feel a few moves short, but still worthwhile.
